review_blob:
Not even beer as I understand the definition, this appalling dishwater has made many attempt to endear itself (who remembers the whole can top ringpull of the nineties?) without much impact. Cloying, overly sweet, overly malty with a fat, flabby finish that qualifies it neither as a quaffer or a compliment to any known cuisine. 

Piss.

Unquestionably the finest lager beer in all of Asia, eclipsing even Kirin and real Tsingtao (the stuff actually made in Qingdao). Sharp, with a slightly bitter aftertaste, medium-bodied but achieving a perfect balance, ultimately. Its 5% alcohol content is not distinct and does not overwhelm the taste. This beer compliments almost every food, Asian or otherwise.
